intro: Scleria borii, commonly known as the slender spikegrass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Scleria borii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its wetland habitat, making it an important component of these ecosystems.
